resources.string: \n Log will show the life cycle,\n Understanding the lifecycle is the first step in learning the activity
A Layout that arranges its children in a single column or a single row. The direction of the row can be set by calling Orientation
A Layout where the positions of the children can be described in relation to each other or to the parent.
FrameLayout is designed to block out an area on the screen to display a single item. Generally, FrameLayout should be used to hold a single child view
A layout that lets you specify exact locations (x/y coordinates) of its children.
attributes and style \n\n A style is a collection of attributes that specify the look and format for a View or window.
Listeners \n\n Listeners are used for any type of asynchronous event in order to implement the code to run when an event occurs.
An intent is an abstract description of an operation to be performed. It can be used with startActivity to launch an Activity
The Adapter provides access to the data items. \nThe Adapter is also responsible for making a View for each item in the data set.
